DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Collection Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Target Anatomic Site Laterality Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action of gathering samples that may be used for subsequent analysis. EXAMPLE(S): blood draw A coded value specifying the side of the body (or a paired organ) that is a target site for a procedure. EXAMPLE(S): bilateral, left, right

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Collection Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Target Anatomic Site Laterality Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:Named locations of or within the body.:Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Biospecimen Collection Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:Named locations of or within the body.:Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
Named locations of or within the body.
Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
